This is something awesome I'm making. It's in progress, though - for now, go check out [OpenSprites](http://opensprites.x10.mx). Basically it's a blog-type thing I still have to style and make look pretty, but considering it uses markdown and is built mostly in JavaScript, I'm pretty proud. Here's what a simple blog post would look like: Stuff That would be stored in a file called `entries/**number**.xml`, with `**number**` being the ID or number of the entry. Technically it doesn't have to be a number but using a number for the file name keeps the entires organized. This post is actually stored at [entries/1.xml](entries/1.xml). After the file is saved inside of `entries`, we need to import it. Importing is done through a JavaScript function inside a file called `blogload.js`. First you'll need to import `blogload.js`: Then, you'll need to import the post into something. For now we'll import in to `document.getElementById("demo")`:
with `NUMBER` being the name / number / id of the post you posted. --- And last of all, it requires the package [marked](https://github.com/chjj/marked). Just include it in your script importing area: ...
